name: jurisprudentially
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is connected with the study of law and the principles on which law is based: The Supreme Court has the responsibility to address this jurisprudentially significant issue. Right now I feel we're in the dark ages jurisprudentially. Related words
jurisprudence
jurisprudential
More examplesFewer examplesIt will be increasingly difficult for the jurisprudentially and geographically isolated country to strike the right balance.It is the function of the court to grant relief against invasion or violation of legally protected interests which are jurisprudentially called rights.
